alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 29 at 10:41AM MST until December 01 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. The heavier amounts will focus over west-facing slopes of northern and western NM. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Far Northwest Highlands, Northwest Highlands, West Central Plateau, Southwest Mountains, and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall is likely to occur in two bursts, the first late tonight through Thursday morning then again Thursday night through Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; West Central Plateau
